Key Match Events: The Sixers allowed the Lakers to shoot 45.7% from beyond the arc.
Philadelphia went nearly four minutes without a basket in one stretch of the third quarter.
The Sixers' bench unit performed well, with Jared McCain leading the team in scoring with 18 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The Sixers started the game struggling to defend the perimeter against the Lakers.
The Sixers' starters struggled, while the bench unit performed well.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sixers' bench unit did well in spelling the starters.
McCain has proven himself to a degree early this season, becoming more willing and adept at working the ball into the paint and finishing with finesse.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sixers' defensive struggles were both inside and out, allowing the Lakers to shoot practically at will in the paint.
McCain's performance was highlighted as a positive aspect despite the overall loss.
